settings.title:
Print 
Studio
settings.text:
Giclée Club is located in the Amsterdam Metropolitan Area (Greater Amsterdam).

We hold business meetings in the city centre or in the trending Amsterdam Noord, so if you'd like to meet for coffee just let us know!

settings.title: Our space and equipment
settings.text: Our studio has the latest gear including powerful computers, printers, cutters as well as safe and dry paper and packaging storage space

settings.subtitle: CONTRIBUTING TO
settings.title: THE WELL-BEING OF OUR PLANET
settings.text:
We have equipped our studio with sun panels relying completely on solar energy for our printing production.
All our papers and packaging are 100% recyclable. Also we drive a fully electric car and we do short trips the typical Dutch way – by bike!

settings.subtitle: CLEAN ENERGY
settings.title: SOLAR PANELS
settings.text: We have installed solar panels on the roof of our print house. They provide all the necessary power for our printing production to run fully on solar energy.

settings.subtitle: CO2 AND NOX FREE
settings.title: TRANSPORTATION
settings.text: The car that we use for work travels is fully electric and we do short trips the typical Amsterdam way – by bike!

settings.subtitle: ECO FRIENDLY PACKAGING
settings.title: SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS
settings.text: All the materials used for our packaging are fully recyclable: from the cardboard packaging itself to the paper tape, jute string, wrapping silk paper, cotton gloves and paper stickers.

settings.subtitle: Colour accuracy
settings.title:
Soft 
Proofing
settings.text:
Get the best impression possible of how your artwork will turn out on paper.

ⓘ Keep in mind that monitors can reproduce billions of colours and even the most advanced printers have a narrower colour gamut.

settings.subtitle: Highly recommended
settings.title: Calibrate your monitor
settings.text:
It is ideal to have a professional IPS monitor to be able to achieve colour accuracy and consistency when working on your digital art and preparing your files for printing.
To calibrate your monitor, you can choose to invite a professional, or to invest in a monitor calibrator (e.g. X-Rite i1Studio).

A calibrated IPS monitor will show the colours as close as possible to how they will be printed out.

settings.subtitle: Install
settings.title: ICC Print Profiles
settings.text:
ICC profiles contain information about how the colours of a specific printer will look like on a specific paper. This way you can see how your artwork will turn out on a certain printer-paper combination. Read more

To install the ICC profiles, please copy the .icc files to the following directories:
MacOS
Finder ➔ Go ➔ Compuer
Macintosch HD/Library/ColorSync/Profiles
Windows 10
C:/Windows/system32/spool/drivers/color

settings.subtitle: Soft proofing in Photoshop
settings.title: Previewing your future print
settings.text:
In order to use the ICC profile of your choice in Photoshop, click View ➔ Proof Setup ➔ Custom.
This opens the Customize Proof Condition window where you can choose the desired ICC profile to simulate the colours of your future print.
In this window, please untick Preserve RGB Numbers, tick Black Point Compensation and choose the Rendering Intent. You can read about Rendering Intents in the next section.

settings.subtitle: Choosing
settings.title: Rendering intents
settings.text:
There are only two rendering intents that are useful for Fine Art proof printing:

Perceptual
● will benefit transitions and gradients
● can cause the image to lighten or de-saturate

Relative Colorimetric
● will provide with more exact tones
● can cause banding of your transitions and gradients

Please choose which rendering intent is the most suitable and advantageous for your image.

settings.subtitle: The last step
settings.title: Save your changes to print
settings.text:
When you are happy with the result of your soft proofing, please convert the file to the ICC profile of your choice. In Photoshop, click Edit ➔ Convert to Profile. Finally, save your file.
When we receive this file we will be able to see which printer and paper combination you chose as we can read this information on the converted file.

settings.subtitle: Hahnemühle Fineart
settings.title:
Certificate 
of 
Authenticity
settings.text: Assure the safety of your unique or limited edition art piece by including Hahnemühle's Certificate of Authenticity in your order

settings.subtitle: Hologram system
settings.title: Security protection
settings.text:
With its Hahnemühle watermark, fluorescent security fibres and safety holograms with unique serial numbers, this deckle edged mould made paper certificate provides your artwork with full security of authenticity.

You can also register your limited edition or unique art piece on Hahnhmühle's Art Registry.

settings.subtitle: How it works
settings.title: Upload your details
settings.text: All you need to do is add the certificate option when ordering your art print, upload your digital signature and fill in the details of your artwork.

settings.subtitle: Giclée quality presentation
settings.title:
Premium 
Portfolio 
Set
settings.art: Art by Ave Calvar, Tim Stief, Augustine Wong, Sappho Bakker
settings.text: Showcase your work in style and create the impression your art deserves

settings.subtitle: Choose your
settings.title: Artisan Paper and its size
settings.text:
You can choose from our selection of Hahnemühle papers and pick your desired size: A5, A4 or A3.
Your portfolio will have the highest printing quality there is on the best paper on the market.

settings.subtitle: Add to your set
settings.title: Cover Letter | CV | Note
settings.text:
Include an A4 cover letter, A4 CV or an A5 note in the set to complete your presentation. Any combination of these items is possible. They will be printed on 160 grams white paper in b/w or colour depending on your uploaded file.

You can choose to use the templates that we created for the cover letter, CV and note.

settings.subtitle: Black premium
settings.title: Envelope with your Logo
settings.text:
Your portfolio prints will be sent in a high quality black envelope with your name or logo on it.
Our A5 and A4 envelopes have a Japanese closure. The A3 envelope comes with a classical closure.

settings.subtitle: Seal Stamp
settings.title: Golden wax
settings.text:
The envelope will be sealed with golden wax for maximum effect. We stamp the wax with a blank round seal stamp.

We will send this envelope to anywhere in the world packed in biodegradable bubble wrap and wrapped in recycled paper for extra protection.

settings.subtitle: Sustainability
settings.title:
Environmental
Awareness
settings.text:
We do our part to make sure our production is carbon-neutral.
This means that all our production emissions are offset.

settings.subtitle: Clean Energy
settings.title: Solar Panels
settings.text: We have installed solar panels on the roof of our print house. They provide all the necessary power for our printing production to run fully on solar energy.

settings.subtitle: CO2 and NOx free
settings.title: Transportation
settings.text: The car that we use for work travels is fully electric and we do short trips the typical Amsterdam way – by bike!

settings.subtitle: ECO FRIENDLY PACKAGING
settings.title: SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS
settings.text: All the materials used for our packaging are fully recyclable: from the cardboard packaging itself to the paper tape, jute string, wrapping silk paper, cotton gloves and paper stickers.

settings.subtitle: Soft proofing
settings.title: ICC Profiles
settings.text:
ICC profiles help you with previewing your art before printing.
It is the best way to simulate the colours of your future print on your monitor.

settings.subtitle: What are
settings.title: ICC Print Profiles
settings.text:
ICC (International Colour Consortium) profiles are files with the extension .icc that contain data of a colour space or of the input/output of a device – for example, a printer, a scanner or a monitor.

In Giclée printing, an ICC profile contains information about how the colours of a certain printer will turn out on a certain paper.

settings.subtitle: Preview your art
settings.title: Soft proofing
settings.text:
In order to preview your future print on your monitor you need to have our ICC profiles installed on your computer.
This way you can access them in Photoshop and see as accurately as possible how your artwork's colours will turn out printed with a specific printer on the paper of your choice.

You can read more about how to install ICC profiles and soft proof your art in our Soft Proofing section.

settings.subtitle: What are
settings.title: ICC Profiles
settings.text:
ICC (International Colour Consortium) profiles are files with the extension .icc that contain data on a colour space or input/output of a device.
When changing colour spaces, ICC profiles are translated into a common space: the Profile Connected Space (PCS).

The PCS uses either the CIELAB(L*a*b*) or the CIEXYZ colorimetric spaces. These were created by Commission Internationale de l'Éclairage, the scientific world authority on light that dates from 1913. Their research connected wavelengths in the electromagnetic visible spectrum to perceived colours in human vision.

When using our ICC profiles, your monitor's ICC profile will be mapped to PCS and then mapped back to the ICC profiles that we provide.
This way you will be able to see on your monitor an approximation of what the printed colours will look like on paper.

settings.subtitle: we are
settings.title:
Artists 
who print 
for artists
settings.text: Giclée Club is an Amsterdam-based family business ran by visual artist and graphic designer Angelina Severino and music artist Alex Severino.

settings.title: Our Vision
settings.text: Giclée Club was born from the will to provide visual artists with a global, affordable and easy-to-use Giclée printing service that meets the highest world standards of museum quality printing.

settings.title: Angelina
settings.text:
When I began my artistic career I used to have my art printed in different places but I was never totally satisfied with the results. Either the quality of the prints were not great or they were not packed carefully enough. Also I could never add a personal touch like a note or a letter to my client. It made me think that probably many other artists have the same problem and that is how the idea of a Giclée printing studio came to life.

After more than 15 years of industry experience as a professional graphic and product designer, I have a strong wish to provide artists with an easy, hassle-free process of ordering their top-of-the-world quality prints and sending them to the destination of their choice with an added personal touch.

I enjoy the magic of a digital art piece materialising through a special machine on amazing, top-of-the-world quality paper.

To see digital art take physical shape is something I truly take pleasure from – it is when art becomes part of your house, your everyday life and starts to exist both in the digital and physical worlds.

www.posteress.com
@posteress_amsterdam

settings.title: Alex
settings.text:
For me, Giclée Club started with a conversation at a café in the centre of Vilnius in Lithuania. Angelina was telling me about the difficulties of printing, exposing art and of her wish to help other artists with these obstacles.
She told me many of her ideas for the future, like for example turning Giclée Club into a physical space, where artists can exhibit and sell their art, and also have a cup of good coffee.

I have always had a love for the visual arts. One way or another they keep finding their way into my life. And now, I find myself contributing to this world by providing technical and customer support to our print house. My wish is to help artists all around the world to bridge any difficulties they may encounter with printing their art.

settings.subtitle: Digital FineArt
settings.title:
Hahnemühle
Papers
settings.text: Hahnemühle's Digital FineArt Collection has a wide range of unique artisan papers with a high age resistance of more than 100 years. This makes them perfect for long-term exhibitions, art collections and special editions.

settings.subtitle: Made in Germany
settings.title: Innovative Paper technology
settings.text:
Founded in 1584, Hahnemühle are the inventors and world market leaders on Digital FineArt papers for inkjet printing and art reproduction.

All paper grades are manufactured according to old recipes from high-quality cotton fibres, cellulose or fast-growing plant fibres and pure spring water.

settings.title: Our Fineart papers
settings.text: We have carefully hand-picked four papers with different characteristics to best suit your preference in terms of texture, colour, coating and composition. All our papers are acid- and lignin-free which prevents them from breaking down or yellowing over time.

settings.subtitle: Matt FineArt Smooth
settings.title: Photo Rag
settings.text:
• 308 gsm
• 100% cotton
• White
• Matt premium inkjet coating
• Characteristic felt structure

The Hahnemühle Photo Rag paper has a delicately textured matt surface. It is one of the most used papers in the world known for its versatility.

This felt structured paper with matt premium inkjet coating produces incredible prints with very bright colours, deep blacks, solid contrasts all in great detail.

settings.subtitle: Matt Fineart Textured
settings.title: German Etching
settings.text:
• 310 gsm
• 100% α-cellulose
• White
• Genuine mould-made paper
• Matt premium inkjet coating
• Clearly defined felt structure

German Etching is a matt mould-made copperplate printing paper with a distinctly textured surface. It is made from 100% alpha cellulose and feels very velvety to the touch which together with its matt inkjet coating makes for prints that amazingly reproduce colours, blacks and contrasts.

This extremely popular Hahnemühle paper is one of the best papers for Fine Art prints and art reproductions, a reputation that came to be thanks to its distinct feel and special surface texture.

settings.subtitle: Glossy
settings.title: Fineart Pearl
settings.text:
• 285 gsm
• 100% α-Cellulose
• Bright white
• Pearl-finish
• Pearl-gloss premium inkjet coating
• Delicately textured surface

The FineArt Pearl is a pure alpha cellulose paper that is provided with a premium inkjet coating which has a mid lustre pearly gloss. This bright white paper has a delicate surface with soft texture that makes for a smooth and silky feel.

Printing on this Hahnemühle paper produces impressive results that make the reproduction of colour, details, contrast and deep blacks stand out.

settings.subtitle: Natural Line
settings.title: Bamboo
settings.text:
• 290 gsm
• 90% bamboo fibres, 10% cotton
• Natural white
• Matt premium inkjet coating
• Soft, lightly textured felt structure

This paper is made from 90% bamboo fibres making it an environmental friendly paper. Its natural white is achieved without any optical brighteners and looks very natural to the eye and its texture feels soft to the touch.

Hahnemühle's Natural Line uses unique raw materials. The plants provide the cellulose and require low maintenance as they grow fast without the need of any chemicals. This means that more cellulose can be produced on the same land with much less water.

settings.subtitle: our
settings.title: Prices
settings.text:
We are proud to provide you with our high-quality Giclée printing service and we are always here for you if you have any questions.

Our prices are transparent and you can use our calculator to see exactly what your print will cost.

settings.subtitle: Our TOP-OF-THE-LINE
settings.title:
Professional
Printers
settings.text:
Giclée printing is made possible by the newest generation of professional inkjet printers that produce incredibly high printing resolutions and use pigment archival inks lasting over 100 years.

Our printers use the most advanced technologies that assure smooth colour transitions, stunning sharpness and the widest colour range possible.

settings.title: HP Designjet Z9+
settings.text:
Maximum Print Size: 44” x 470”

Print Resolution: 2400 x 1200 DPI

Technology: HP Thermal Inkjet

Ink Technology: HP Pixel Control

Ink Archival Life: 250 years

settings.subtitle: Latest
settings.title: Print Technology
settings.text: The HP DesignJet Z9+ has a HP Thermal Inkjet HD printhead with dual drop technology down to 3 picoliters and 2112 printhead nozzles per colour making for a staggering total of 21.120.

settings.subtitle: Advanced
settings.title: Colour representation
settings.text: It uses 9 pigment based inks, namely: Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Matte Black, Photo Black, Chromatic Red, Chromatic Green, Chromatic Blue and Grey. This means it can reproduce colour schemes to extremely high fidelities as it disposes of both RGB and CMYK colour models.

settings.subtitle: smooth fluid
settings.title: Transitions and Gradients
settings.text: The blacks are of incredible depth and crispness as the HP DesignJet Z9+ has a Matte and Photo Black cartridges as well as a designated Grey cartridge to further perfect gradients and colour transitions.

settings.subtitle: Automated Cutting
settings.title: V-Trimmer Technology
settings.text:
Our HP DesignJet Z9+ has an integrated Vertical Trimmer in addition to the standard horizontal trimmer.

This means that it cuts your print on all sides, eliminating any human error and delivering a perfect cut result.

settings.title: Epson surecolor P700
settings.text:
Maximum Print Size: A3

Print Resolution: 5760 x 1440 DPI

Technology: Epson MicroPiezo AMC

Ink Technology: UltraChrome PRO10

Ink Archival Life: up to 400 years

settings.subtitle: Advanced
settings.title: Surecolor Technology
settings.text: The Epson SureColor P700 uses the same technology as its large-format bigger siblings. Its state-of-the-art MicroPiezo AMC 10-channel drop-on-demand printhead with ink-repelling coating technology is created to produce stunning results.

settings.subtitle: High-tech
settings.title: Printheads
settings.text: The P700 advanced printheads produce drops of 1.5 picoliters with Variable Droplet Technology that are able to spray up to three different dot sizes per line. It has 180 printhead nozzles per colour at its disposal, making for a total of 1.80 and using pigment based inks.

settings.subtitle: Vivid vibrant
settings.title: Colours and Blacks
settings.text: The Epson SureColor P700 operates with 10 colour cartridges: Cyan, Light Cyan, Vivid Magenta, Vivid Light Magenta, Yellow, Grey, Light Grey, Violet, Photo Black and Matte Black. They make incredible high definition art prints that last for up to 200 years for colour and up to 400 years for black and white.

settings.title: Your Choice
settings.text: Whatever you want we get

settings.subtitle: Preview your art piece
settings.title:
Proof Printing 
Strip
settings.text:
It is great to feel safe when ordering a big art print.
Proof printing is here to help you with it. For only €5!

settings.subtitle: When Printing large format
settings.title: Proof print your art
settings.text: If you are printing an art piece bigger than A3 it is a good idea to order a proof printing strip. This way you will really know what your large format print will look and feel like.

settings.subtitle: preparing
settings.title: Your strip
settings.text:
The strip size is 1100x100mm or 44"x4".
If you artwork's width is smaller than 1100mm you can place different parts of your image on the strip.

It's a good idea to choose the most important part of your image to be proof printed.
For design, illustration and painting reproduction choose the most colourful or complex area.
For photography choose an area with highlights, shadows and mid tones to check the tonal range of your print.

To find more information on preparing your files for print, please visit our help page.

settings.subtitle: WHENEVER YOU ARE READY
settings.title: ORDER YOUR ART PRINT
settings.art: Art by Ryan Stone, MagicPattern, Steve Johnson, Sharon McCutcheon, Posteress, John James Audubon, Zak, Photo Boards, Prince Akachi, Akira Hojo

settings.text_1: We offer five sample packs with different types of artworks printed on our Hahnhemühle papers.
settings.text_3: Give your art the presentation it deserves. In a stylish black envelope branded with your logo for maximum effect.

settings.subtitle: Before sending to print
settings.title:
Prepare 
your files
settings.text:
Making sure that your digital art piece is correctly prepared is the key for a great quality, high-definition print.
Follow our guidelines to get the best out of your art print.

It can be a little daunting at first, so please feel completely free to contact us via email or on the chat. You can ask us any questions you might have about preparing your art for printing.

settings.subtitle: Standard Giclée
settings.title: Printing Requirements
settings.text:
To get the best printing results we need to receive a flattened TIFF file with 300 PPI resolution, RGB Color at 8 bit in your desired size in sRGB or Adobe RGB (1998) colour profile.

ⓘ When you start creating your digital artwork in raster (e.g. in Photoshop) it is wise to think about the maximum size (inches or mm) that you would like to print in the future and set your document to 300 PPI.

settings.subtitle: Resolution under 300 PPI
settings.title: FInd out YOUR MAXIMUM PRINT SIZE
settings.text:
Ideally your digital artwork was initially created at 300 PPI with your desired width and height in inches or millimetres.

What if your file has a resolution lower than 300 PPI? For example you created your digital file at a lower resolution or you took a photograph at 72 PPI and you would like to still print it out.

To find out the maximum print size, in Photoshop you can click Image ➔ Image Size, untick Resample and input 300 PPI in the Resolution box.
Photoshop will then show you the maximum printable height and width in your desired unit (inches or mm) at 300 PPI.

settings.subtitle: Warning
settings.title: Do not artificially increase your file's resolution
settings.text:
If you increase the resolution in Photoshop by clicking Image ➔ Image Size with Resample ticked, Photoshop will artificially create more pixels per inch without improving the quality of the image.

This forced resolution change will result in a low quality image that is not suitable for printing.

settings.subtitle: Scalable
settings.title: Vector art
settings.text:
A vector-based artwork (e.g. created in Adobe Illustrator) is scalable to any size without quality loss.
To print it out, you will need to export your vector artwork as a raster TIFF file in your desired unit (inches or mm) at 300 PPI.

In order to create a correct TIFF file for printing, please follow our export instructions in the Vector File Export section below.

settings.subtitle: 10mm
settings.title: Safe area
settings.text:
Our professional printers produce borderless prints – this is why we need to receive your artwork in the exact size that you would like it to be printed in. This means that no added bleed area is required.

It is important to keep all the essential elements of your artwork (e.g. logos or texts) inside your printed image without them being cut off in the printing process or overlapped with a frame.
To do so, please place all the important elements of your artwork 10mm away from the edges on all sides of your image.

settings.subtitle: Optional
settings.title: Borders
settings.text:
If you would like your work to be printed out with borders of your desired thickness, please include them in your file.

ⓘ It is important to place the borders inside your chosen print area. If you were to add the borders on the outside of your artwork, it would change the height and width of your file.

settings.subtitle: Merge Layers
settings.title: Flatten your image
settings.text:
As you get closer to exporting your file it is important to remember to flatten your image by merging all the layers. To do so, in Photoshop click Layer ➔ Flatten your image.

ⓘ Please make sure that you have deleted all paths, masks and alpha channels.

settings.subtitle: Photoshop
settings.title: Raster File Export
settings.text:
In Photoshop, please set your Color Mode to RGB Color at 8 Bits/Channel (Image ➔ Mode) and set your Color Profile to sRGB or Adobe RGB (1998) (Edit ➔ Color Settings).

Save your image as a TIFF file with no compression (File ➔ Save As).

settings.subtitle: Illustrator
settings.title: Vector File Export
settings.text:
If your file is vector-based and created in Illustrator, please make sure that your vector file is in the Color Mode RGB Color (File ➔ Document Color Mode) and your Color Profile is set to sRGB or Adobe RGB (1998) (Edit ➔ Color Settings).

Then export your artwork as a raster TIFF file in 300 PPI. You can do this by clicking File ➔ Export ➔ Export As.

settings.text: We ship to all of Europe for free and for money to the rest of the world.

settings.subtitle: Safe sturdy
settings.title:
Branded
Packaging
settings.art: Art by Pawel Czerwinski, Dan Christian Padure, Jessica Dismorr, Jene Stephaniuk
settings.text: Your prints can be sent with your name | logo | pattern | signature | you name it, in a sturdy sustainable package that will keep your art safe.

settings.subtitle: Branded package sticker
settings.title: YOUR ART, YOUR way
settings.text: When ordering your art print you can choose to add your name, logo, pattern or signature to the packaging. We will print it full colour on a sustainable sticker and place it on the package.

settings.subtitle: Your art protected
settings.title: Silk Tissue paper
settings.text:
The first step to ensure your art print's protection is to carefully apply silk tissue paper before rolling it.
We handle your art using protective cotton gloves to ensure there are no scratches or folds on your print while the packaging process takes place.

settings.subtitle: Sturdy  robust sustainable
settings.title: Triangular packaging
settings.text: Your art print is then placed into our strong triangular tubes that ensure the protection of your art. Once delivered, the triangular shape helps with grabbing hold of and taking out the print without damaging it. This guarantees a safe, risk-free delivery and unpacking of your art.

settings.subtitle: Cotton recyclable
settings.title: Handling Gloves
settings.text: We include cotton handling gloves in the packaging so that your art can be unpacked and handled in the safest way possible.

settings.subtitle: Eco friendly packaging
settings.title: Sustainable Materials
settings.text: All the materials used for packaging are fully recyclable: from the cardboard packaging itself to the paper tape, jute string, wrapping silk paper, cotton gloves and paper stickers.

settings.subtitle: WHENEVER YOU ARE READY
settings.title: ORDER YOUR ART PRINT
settings.art: Art by Ryan Stone, MagicPattern, Steve Johnson, Sharon McCutcheon, Posteress, John James Audubon, Zak, Photo Boards, Prince Akachi, Akira Hojo

settings.text_1: We offer five sample packs with different types of artworks printed on our Hahnhemühle papers.
settings.text_2: Ensure that your large format art print meets your expectations regarding colour representation, sharpness and quality.
settings.text_3: Give your art the presentation it deserves. In a stylish black envelope branded with your logo for maximum effect.

settings.subtitle: CONTRIBUTING TO
settings.title: THE WELL-BEING OF OUR PLANET
settings.text:
We have equipped our studio with sun panels relying completely on solar energy for our printing production.
All our papers and packaging are 100% recyclable. Also we drive a fully electric car and we do short trips the typical Dutch way – by bike!

settings.subtitle: Hahnemühle Fineart
settings.title: Certificate of authenticity
settings.text:
This deckle edged mould made paper certificate contains a Hahnemühle watermark, fluorescent security fibres and a set of serialised numbered holograms.
With the Certificate of Authenticity your Limited Edition artwork is protected and assured of its legitimateness.

settings.subtitle: Test Strip
settings.title: Proof Printing
settings.text: Ensure that your large format art print meets your expectations regarding colour representation, sharpness and quality. On our test strip you will be able to see a part of your art piece on the Hahnemühle paper of your choice.

settings.subtitle: Best-in-class
settings.title: High-end printers
settings.text: We print your art with the latest top-of-the-line printers HP DesignJet Z9+ with V-Trimmer and Epson SureColor SC-P700. These printers use the most advanced technologies that assure smooth colour transitions, stunning sharpness and the widest colour range possible.

settings.subtitle: why choose
settings.title: giclée printing
settings.text:
Giclée (from French gicler, meaning to spray) is the name for latest technology inkjet printing using pigment-based archival inks. This method produces art prints with a longevity that matches the strictest museum requirements.

Our high-end printers and acid-free Fine Art papers create Giclée prints of incredible quality and exceptional colour range.

settings.testimonial: And we also ship worldwide of course
settings.author: FREE Shipping for European Orders

settings.testimonial: Latest printing and paper tech at your service
settings.author: Outstanding Print Quality

settings.testimonial: And no VAT for all other countries
settings.author: EU customs-free

settings.subtitle: SUSTAINABLE STURDY
settings.title: BRANDED PACKAGING
settings.text:
You can choose to brand the package sticker with your name, logo, signature or pattern – you name it!

Your art print will be protected with silk tissue paper, packed in 100% recyclable robust cardboard tube and will include cotton handling gloves.

settings.subtitle: a5 prints
settings.title: Sample packs
settings.art:
Art by John James Audubon, Ahmed Syed,
MagicPattern, Jene Stephaniuk
settings.text: We offer five sample packs with different types of artworks printed on our Hahnhemühle papers. We cover different art disciplines: Illustration, Graphic Design, Photography, Painting and Mixed Arts.

settings.subtitle: Why Choose
settings.title:
GICLÉE 
PRINTING
settings.text: Giclée is the name for the highest museum quality Fine Art printing. A professional Giclée print is the result of high-end printing technology applied on Fine Art inkjet papers.

settings.title: Title
settings.text: Giclée printing creates the most colourful and long-lasting art prints – be it digital illustration, graphic design, professional photographs or reproductions of paintings.

settings.subtitle: LATEST BEST-IN-CLASS
settings.title: PROFESSIONAL HIGH-END PRINTERS
settings.text:
Giclée printing is made possible by the newest generation of professional inkjet printers that produce incredibly high printing resolutions and use pigment archival inks lasting over 100 years.

These printers use the latest technologies that allow for smooth colour transitions and provide with incredible sharpness and the widest colour range possible.

settings.subtitle: ARCHIVAL ACID-FREE
settings.title: FINE ART PAPERS
settings.text:
Another essential component of true Giclée printing are unique high-quality papers created specifically for high-end printing. They are characterised by artisanal surface textures and special inkjet coatings that bring out an incredible amount of detail, contrast, brightness of colours and amazing depths of blacks.

A key factor of these papers is their longevity of more than 100 years, which makes them ideal for Fine Art printing, art collections, limited editions, museum and gallery exhibitions.

settings.subtitle: MUSEUM ARCHIVAL QUALITY
settings.title: HAHNEMÜHLE FINEART PAPERS
settings.text:
Founded in 1584, Hahnemühle are the inventors and world market leaders on Digital FineArt papers for inkjet printing and art reproduction.
You can choose from our hand-picked selection of their unique FineArt papers:
Photo Rag, FineArt Pearl, German Etching and Bamboo.
